channel.title: Nasa
channel.description: Well I'm bored as fuck right now and I was thinking about games like Halo and map hacking, and how it kinda pushes you back when you get to the end of the map. I was thinking that our end of the atmosphere deal is kind of like that, and that whatever made Earth made that to be like our end of the map barrier. Also, there isn't life on other planets because no one really expects people to get out of the map so they don't waste their time working on something no one will see, just like the games. Therefor NASA is technically one big map hack that lets us escape our confinement. What do ya think?

item.title: Nasa
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

NASA is really just a way for the government to spend money that could be helping black people get out of the ghetto, why do they do this? America hates lazy black people.

item.title: Nasa
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

shpoanator:

It’s just an example and I don’t know where I stated that NASA changes laws of physics.

You compared space travel to a map hack. A map hack edits the ‘rules’, space travel doesn’t. It’s an illogical comparison.

Read full topic

item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I think this was the reason mimes were made.

item.title: Nasa
item.dc:creator: @shpoanator shpoanator
item.description:
@shpoanator wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:2, topic:206457”][quote author=shpoanator link=topic=272266.msg2230490#msg2230490 date=1211103471]
What do ya think?
[/quote]
I think you need to play less halo. This isn’t a video game, and NASA doesn’t change any laws of physics.[/quote]

I’ve played Halo like twice in my life over 3 years ago. It’s just an example and I don’t know where I stated that NASA changes laws of physics.

Read full topic
